intro: Specularia ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy pink or white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the flora in its native range.
